title: CacheConnection Class — CacheConnection
text: R6 class handles persistent -memory caching data used Countdown 2030 analysis reporting workflows. supports tracking various internal data objects, reactive updates (Shiny apps), note-taking report annotations, saving/loading .rds files.

what: Adjust Service Data for Coverage Analysis — adjust_service_data
title: Adjust Service Data for Coverage Analysis — adjust_service_data
text: adjust_service_data function processes DHIS-2 health service data, correcting incomplete reporting, applying k-factor adjustments accurate scaling, managing outliers consistency data analysis. standardization supports reliable comparisons immunization coverage health service utilization studies.

title: Adjust Service Data for Coverage Analysis — adjust_service_data
Adjust Service Data for Coverage Analysis — adjust_service_data
text: .data cd_data dataframe, typically containing health facility data DHIS-2 monthly service counts district. adjustment character string specifying type adjustment apply: "default": Applies default k-factor 0.25 across indicator groups. "custom": Uses user-defined k_factors different indicator groups, values 0 1. "none": Returns data without adjustments. k_factors named numeric vector custom k-factor values 0 1 indicator group (e.g., c(anc = 0.3, idelv = 0.2, ...)). Used adjustment = "custom".

title: Adjust Service Data for Coverage Analysis — adjust_service_data
text: cd_adjusted_data object containing adjusted service data, outliers flagged managed, missing values imputed.

title: Adjust Service Data for Coverage Analysis — adjust_service_data
text: function prepares service data series steps ensure data quality consistency: Validation: Checks structure .data ensures adjustment argument valid. custom adjustments, k_factors must specified contain valid values. k-Factor Defaults: Default k-factor values set 0.25 indicator group, unless overridden user-provided values k_factors. Reporting Completeness: Flags district-year reporting rates 75% imputes missing data using district-level medians account reporting inconsistencies. k-Factor Scaling: Adjusts service counts based k-factor reporting rate using following scaling formula: $$AdjustedValue = Value \times \left(1 + \left(\frac{1}{ReportingRate/100} - 1\right) \times k\right)$$ ReportingRate reporting rate percent, k k-factor indicator group. Outlier Detection: Identifies flags extreme outliers using Hampel's X84 method, marking values exceed 5 Median Absolute Deviations (MAD) median. Data Imputation: Replaces remaining missing values district-level medians ensure data completeness.

title: Adjust Service Data for Coverage Analysis — adjust_service_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Default adjustment adjusted_data <- adjust_service_data(data, adjustment = "default")  # Custom adjustment with specific k-factors custom_k <- c(   anc = 0.3, idelv = 0.2, pnc = 0.35, vacc = 0.4,   opd = 0.3, ipd = 0.25 ) adjusted_data_custom <- adjust_service_data(data,   adjustment = "custom",   k_factors = custom_k )  # No adjustment unadjusted_data <- adjust_service_data(data, adjustment = "none") } # }

title: Calculate Yearly Indicator Ratios Summary with Expected Ratios — calculate_ratios_summary
text: function computes yearly summaries specified indicator ratios, assessing trends across years providing actual expected ratios indicator. evaluates specified indicator pairs calculate ratios compares actual values expected ratios, based predefined survey coverage values. summary facilitates monitoring consistency key health indicators time.

title: Calculate Yearly Indicator Ratios Summary with Expected Ratios — calculate_ratios_summary
code: calculate_ratios_summary(   .data,   survey_coverage = c(anc1 = 0.98, penta1 = 0.97, penta3 = 0.89, opv1 = 0.97, opv3 =     0.78, pcv1 = 0.97, rota1 = 0.96),   anc1_penta1_mortality = 1.07,   ratio_pairs = list(ratioAP = c("anc1", "penta1"), ratioPP = c("penta1", "penta3")),   adequate_range = c(1, 1.5),   region = NULL )

title: Calculate Yearly Indicator Ratios Summary with Expected Ratios — calculate_ratios_summary
text: .data data frame containing yearly data specified indicators. Expected columns include district, year, additional numeric columns health indicators, anc1 penta1. survey_coverage named vector assumed coverage rates indicator. Default c(anc1 = 0.98, penta1 = 0.97, penta3 = 0.89, opv1 = 0.97, opv3 = 0.78, pcv1 = 0.97, rota1 = 0.96). anc1_penta1_mortality numeric multiplier applied specifically "ratioAP" ratio anc1 penta1, account assumed mortality anc1 penta1. Default 1.07. ratio_pairs named list specifying indicator pairs ratios calculated. Format: list("ratioName" = c("numerator", "denominator")). Default pairs include: "ratioAP": Ratio anc1 penta1, adjusted anc1_penta1_mortality. "ratioPP": Ratio penta1 penta3. "ratioOO": Ratio opv1 opv3. "ratioPPcv": Ratio penta1 pcv1. "ratioPR": Ratio penta1 rota1. adequate_range numeric vector length 2 defining acceptable range adequacy checks. Ratios within range marked adequate; outside range, inadequate. Default c(1, 1.5). region Optional. Restrict analysis one region (adminlevel_1).

title: Calculate Yearly Indicator Ratios Summary with Expected Ratios — calculate_ratios_summary
text: cd_ratios_summary object, data frame containing: year: Year calculated ratio, additional row "Expected Ratio" represent expected values indicator ratio based survey_coverage. Indicator Ratios: Columns ratio, showing actual yearly values expected value row based survey_coverage. Additional Columns: Health indicator values year.

title: Generate Adjusted and Unadjusted Service Counts by Year — generate_adjustment_values
Generate Adjusted and Unadjusted Service Counts by Year — generate_adjustment_values
text: .data cd_data dataframe containing service data adjustments. adjustment character string specifying adjustment type: "default": Applies preset k-factors (e.g., 0.25) indicator group. "custom": Uses user-specified k_factors values indicator group. "none": Skips adjustments, returning raw data. k_factors named numeric vector custom k-factor values 0 1 indicator group (e.g., c(anc = 0.3, idelv = 0.2, ...)). Required adjustment = "custom".

title: Generate Adjusted and Unadjusted Service Counts by Year — generate_adjustment_values
text: cd_adjustment_values tibble containing: Columns unadjusted values, suffixed _raw. Columns adjusted values, suffixed _adj. year column indicating year count.

title: Generate Adjusted and Unadjusted Service Counts by Year — generate_adjustment_values
text: function performs following steps: Data Validation: Ensures .data cd_data class adjustment correctly specified. Unadjusted Summation: Calculates yearly sums unadjusted service counts. Adjusted Summation: Applies adjust_service_data() compute adjusted values, calculates yearly sums. Combining Results: Merges unadjusted adjusted yearly counts comparison.

title: Generate Adjusted and Unadjusted Service Counts by Year — generate_adjustment_values
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Generate adjustment values with default k-factors adjustment_values_default <- generate_adjustment_values(data, adjustment = "default")  # Generate adjustment values with custom k-factors custom_k <- c(anc = 0.3, idelv = 0.2, pnc = 0.35, vacc = 0.4, opd = 0.3, ipd = 0.25) adjustment_values_custom <-   generate_adjustment_values(data, adjustment = "custom", k_factors = custom_k)  # Generate unadjusted values only unadjusted_values <- generate_adjustment_values(data, adjustment = "none") } # }

Specifies administrative level aggregation. Available options : 'national', 'adminlevel_1', 'district'.
